header.#text:
Home Energy
			 Savings Retrofit Rebate Program

			 Retrofit Rebate Program.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the

,
			 shall—

text.#text:
Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of
			 this Act, the

establish a
			 Federal Rebate Processing System which shall serve as a database and
			 information technology system that will allow rebate aggregators to submit
			 claims for reimbursement using standard data protocols;

establish a
			 national retrofit Web site that provides information on the Home Energy Savings
			 Retrofit Rebate Program, including—

how
			 to participate in the program; and

make available
			 model forms for demonstrating compliance with all applicable requirements of
			 this Act, which shall be required to be submitted by—

each quality
			 assurance provider on completion of field verification.

text.#text: In carrying out

A contractor may perform retrofit work under the
			 Home Energy Savings Retrofit Rebate Program in a State if the
			 contractor—

meets all
			 applicable contractor licensing requirements established by the State;
is—

accredited
			 by—

BPI
			 as an Accredited Contractor;

RESNET as an
			 Energy Smart Home Performance Team;

the Air
			 Conditioning Contractors of America as a QA Home Performance Contractor;

a
			 State-based certification program established to carry out State energy, clean
			 air, or environmental programs; or

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for this purpose;

			 assurance inspections; and

subjects the

employs, or
			 otherwise utilizes subcontractors who employ, individuals to complete

			 retrofit who are certified by—
BPI;
RESNET;

the Air Conditioning Contractors of

a regional or State Department of Energy

other contractor
			 or worker certification programs approved by the

holds insurance
			 coverage of at least $1,000,000 for general liability, and for such other
			 purposes and in such other amounts as required by the State; and

provides
			 warranties to the homeowner that completed work will—

be free of
			 significant defects;

be installed in
			 accordance with the specifications of the manufacturer, and all applicable
			 State and local codes; and

perform properly
			 for a period of at least 1 year after the date of completion of the
			 work.

A contractor who performs
			 retrofit work under the Home Energy Savings Retrofit Rebate Program must sign a
			 written or electronic contract with the homeowner that includes—

an agreement to
			 not increase the cost of the home improvement as a result of the rebates
			 received under this Act with respect to physical improvements made to the
			 home;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 an agreement to provide the homeowner, before a contract is executed between

			 rebate amount the contractor intends to apply for with respect to eligible work
			 under this Act; and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Home Owner Managing Energy Savings Act of 2013/s:7

header.#text:
Home Energy
			 Savings Retrofit Rebate Program

text.#text:
If a qualified home energy efficiency retrofit of a home
			 is carried out after January 1, 2014, by a qualified contractor in accordance
			 with this section, rebates shall be awarded for retrofits that achieve home
			 energy savings in accordance with this Act.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the amount of a rebate
			 provided to the owner of a home or a designee of the owner under this section
			 shall be—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Home Owner Managing Energy Savings Act of 2013/s:8/ss:e

text.#text: Subject to

$2,000 for a 20–24
			 percent reduction in home energy use;

$3,000 for a 25–29
			 percent reduction in home energy use;

$4,000 for a 30–34
			 percent reduction in home energy use;

$5,000 for a 35–39
			 percent reduction in home energy use;

$6,000 for a 40–44
			 percent reduction in home energy use;

$7,000 for a 45–49
			 percent reduction in home energy use; and

$8,000 for a 50
			 percent or more reduction in home energy use.

submission of the
			 required rebate forms; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Home Owner Managing Energy Savings Act of 2013/s:8/ss:b/p:1/sp:B

the
			 completion of any quality assurance assessment required under

shall establish a cost effective schedule of required quality assurance

less than 0.07
			 lbs per million BTU for outdoor boilers and furnaces.

A qualified home energy efficiency retrofit is a retrofit
			 that implements measures, during a rebate-eligible year in the existing
			 principal residence of the homeowner which is located in the United States,
			 intended to reduce the energy use of such residence. A qualified home energy
			 efficiency retrofit shall—

be implemented and
			 installed by a qualified contractor;

			 that fuel type used over the same period.
